meanings.definition: In a mischievous or playful manner
meanings.sent1: He grinned roguishly as he played a prank on his friend.
meanings.sent2: The child winked roguishly at his sibling before running off to hide.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail roguishly after stealing a sock.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled roguishly as she plotted her next practical joke.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel chattered roguishly as it stole nuts from the bird feeder.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of a rogue or rascal
meanings.sent1: He had a roguishly charming smile that won over everyone he met.
meanings.sent2: The cat had a roguishly playful demeanor, always getting into mischief.
meanings.sent3: The roguishly handsome pirate captain led his crew on daring adventures.
meanings.sent4: Her roguishly tousled hair gave her a carefree and rebellious look.
meanings.sent5: The roguishly clever fox outsmarted the other animals in the forest.
